Dear Students and Parents,

The upcoming School Board meeting is at 6:30pm on Wednesday, July 29th at Pelham Elementary School. The Superintendent will present his reopening plan at this meeting.

If you are interested in making public comments, you can either attend in person or email your comments to mmckenna@pelhamsd.org by 3:00pm on Wednesday.

-We welcome comments on our school operations and programs. In public session, however, the Board will not hear personal complaints of school personnel nor complaints against any person connected with the school system.

-We appreciate that speakers will conduct themselves in a civil manner.

Thank you.

Sincerely,

Chip McGee

Thank you for your patience and your energy.

Sincerely,

Chip McGee

I hope everyone has the opportunity to enjoy this great weather on this long Memorial Day weekend. Just a quick reminder that meal deliveries will be Tuesday, May 26 and Thursday, May 28 due to the Monday holiday.

Even though the Memorial Day parades won't happen and the celebrating summer season bbq’s may not take place this year please, remember that Memorial Day wasn’t about celebrating or car sales. It is a time to honor the deaths of our fellow men and women who died in the service to our country. It is a time to have quiet, reflective thought on this ultimate sacrifice they gave in service to our country. This year provides us an opportunity to see past the typical celebrations and remember the intention of Memorial Day and pay respect to those who have died and recognize the sacrifices of their families. We honor them by remembering them. A huge thank you to all our Veterans who took that risk in order to serve our country.

Sincerely,

Bill Furbush

Every two years parents and guardians of students with disabilities are asked to participate in a parent involvement survey through the NH Department of Education. Typically, these surveys are mailed out to parents, but as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic the surveys will be completed electronically this year. If you are a parent of a child who receives special education services we ask that you help us and the department of education to improve the supports and services provided by completing this survey. To complete the survey please click on one of the following links:

For families of students in K-12: bit.ly/nhdoefamilyk12

For families of students in Preschool: bit.ly/nhdoefamilypreschool

Thank you for taking the time to offer us the valuable input that we need to inspire success one mind at a time.

Dr. Lessard

post_text:
Dear Pelham Community,

As of last night we had no intentions of an early release as after observing weather reports and participating in the superintendents call with the National Weather Service, the snow was not predicted to arrive until after dismissal around 5:00 p.m. giving us plenty of time to transport students home safely. This morning weather forecasters moved up the anticipated start time of this storm. It is now predicted to be in our area by 2:00 p.m. Dismissing early is one of the most challenging decisions as it is a huge inconvenience to parents to accommodate such a decision. However, the safety of the students is of the utmost importance to us and far out weighs the challenges to accommodate an early release decision. I wish to give families notice that this decision may be necessary to keep students safe and I wish for all parents to prepare for a possible early dismissal today.

If such a decision is made it will be made before 11:00 a.m. as the weather reports become updated.

Sincerely,
Superintendent Bill Furbush
